comment: Dr. Holliday is a great person but this course was too unorganized. The assignments were random and had nothing to do with the lectures, and the lectures were hard to follow. I sent emails to her through the semester with no response, and she is a super slow grader. There were 2 exams, weekly quizzes, and either a paper or research proposal.

I love Holliday! Her class was very easy and stress free. Her lectures were very interesting and she does great explaining. Course Structure: Lecture from Powerpoint (posted to D2L), Artifacts, Quizzes (open-notes), Exams (open-notes), In-class assignments, and Homework. Assignments may seem like alot, but they were so easy.

Dr. Holliday is a fantastic professor! Her lectures are very entertaining and she allows the whole class to get involved in the discussion. The course contains no tests, just quizzes, projects, and other smaller activities. She's very understanding of late work and gives multiple opportunities to turn something in. Definitely recommend taking her!

You'll love Dr. Holliday the second you meet her. No exams, just projects that you can basically do whatever you want with. Her lectures are engaging and there are in class assignments that really help you understand everything. Very little homework as well. Just a great experience overall.

I cannot say enough good things about Dr. Holliday. She turns what could be an extremely difficult class into a fun educational experience. I was always excited to attend her lectures. Instead of tests, you complete fun, creative projects and the quizzes are very simple and straight forward. She has been the best professor I've had so far.

Physio is not an easy class but Dr. Holliday is super cool and makes it really interesting!! She does an in class credit assignment every week and her tests aren't actually tests, they're like create your own knowledge projects with the key terms from the chapters we learn in class. There's so many notes but she also does fun stuff in class too!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Holliday is an amazing Professor that clearly cares. The course material is interesting, which is a plus. I love that she doesn't just focus on her course material. She does wellness checks with her students. She is incredibly understanding. And she had a career day for us. She wants overall success for her students outside of class as well

Dr. Holliday really cares about her students. She makes lectures interesting. I recommend attending just due to the fact that the content is not easy. 3 exams. A few quizzes. A few discussions. She is more of a laid, back professor, and she is very easy to talk to if you need more help in her class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Love her. Shes new at KSU (Fall 2020) and absolutely amazing. I recommend taking her if possible. She facilitated great conversation and is the first professor I would actually want to go out to hang with. She studies drugs and is very open to discussing real questions that actually apply to college kids. I mean, not me... but, yeah... shes cool.
